alert.note: Alert for Mellette; Todd (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued March 31 at 2:31AM MDT until March 31 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...Blizzard conditions late this afternoon and early evening for south-central South Dakota... .A strong winter storm will bring heavy snow across southern South Dakota today. Strong gusty northerly winds will develop this afternoon with the highest speeds (above 50 MPH) over south- central South Dakota as blizzard conditions develop. Travel will be very difficult where warning are in place today. ...BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM THIS MORNING TO 10 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions developing by late afternoon. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 9 inches and ice accumulations of a light glaze. Winds gusting as high as 55 mph. * WHERE...Mellette County and Todd County. This includes the Tribal Lands of the Rosebud Reservation. * WHEN...From 7 AM this morning to 10 PM CDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Strong winds could cause extensive damage to trees and power lines.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means the combination of snow, blowing snow, and strong winds will create dangerous whiteout conditions. Road conditions are available on your smartphone from the 5 1 1 app for your state.
